formattedAddress: 202 Spring St, New York, NY 10012, USA
adrFormatAddress: 202 Spring St, New York, NY 10012, USA

editorialSummary.text: Celebrated local sushi chain serving traditional rolls & sake in a chic, intimate space.

originalText.text: Went here with a friend after I had them in California. The food was amazing as always. My friend thought that the food was life changing which I said the same thing first time I ate here. That being said the experience felt a lot less intimate and personal so I would recommend sitting at the bar.

text.text: Went here with a friend after I had them in California. The food was amazing as always. My friend thought that the food was life changing which I said the same thing first time I ate here. That being said the experience felt a lot less intimate and personal so I would recommend sitting at the bar.

originalText.text: How do they do it? Great fresh fish, in a lovely warmly lit space, at $43pp. The lack of tipping made me and my gf feel so welcome. Just a lovely experience all round.

text.text: How do they do it? Great fresh fish, in a lovely warmly lit space, at $43pp. The lack of tipping made me and my gf feel so welcome. Just a lovely experience all round.

originalText.text: Good for the price: $37 lunch set at a no-tipping establishment. This format allows the rice to arrive slightly warm for each piece. The consistency of the rice does leave something to be desired, though: wet and sticky, as if the rice wasn’t washed enough. This might be needed to form the sushi quickly without having it falling apart. The restaurant was packed and the kitchen had to move quickly.

text.text: Good for the price: $37 lunch set at a no-tipping establishment. This format allows the rice to arrive slightly warm for each piece. The consistency of the rice does leave something to be desired, though: wet and sticky, as if the rice wasn’t washed enough. This might be needed to form the sushi quickly without having it falling apart. The restaurant was packed and the kitchen had to move quickly.

originalText.text: Had a great visit to Sugarfish on a rainy afternoon. Getting a table was super quick and service by Maple was incredibly friendly as we were explained the process and items on the menu. We went with the Nozawa Bar Premium Sake and the Don’t Think. Just Eat. Trust Me. After having the normal Trust Me lunch before, I have to say the sushi is included in the larger lunch isn’t much of a deal. I’d recommend the Trust Me and ordering additional pieces a la carte. The larger lunch definitely gives you exposure to different pieces but the real noticeable one would be the Lobster hand roll and Pink lobster nigiri. Pictured is the salmon sashimi, chutoro, salmon, albacore nigiri, toro hand roll, chutoro, pink lobster, sea bream and unagi nigiri. All were fantastic with shoutouts to the salmon and the toro. Would definitely come again and order more a la carte.

text.text: Had a great visit to Sugarfish on a rainy afternoon. Getting a table was super quick and service by Maple was incredibly friendly as we were explained the process and items on the menu. We went with the Nozawa Bar Premium Sake and the Don’t Think. Just Eat. Trust Me. After having the normal Trust Me lunch before, I have to say the sushi is included in the larger lunch isn’t much of a deal. I’d recommend the Trust Me and ordering additional pieces a la carte. The larger lunch definitely gives you exposure to different pieces but the real noticeable one would be the Lobster hand roll and Pink lobster nigiri. Pictured is the salmon sashimi, chutoro, salmon, albacore nigiri, toro hand roll, chutoro, pink lobster, sea bream and unagi nigiri. All were fantastic with shoutouts to the salmon and the toro. Would definitely come again and order more a la carte.

originalText.text:
I am absolutely obsessed with this place. The sushi is so fresh and so delicious- I think about it all the time. There are no reservations- so you have to go in and put your name down, and there’s usually a bit of a wait. The service overall is very fast, so you can be in and out of the restaurant quite quickly.

We did the dinner “Trust Me” and I think it was the perfect amount of food. I’ve also done the “Nozawa Trust Me”, but personally I liked the regular “trust me” just as much but for less money. Everything is served perfectly fresh, the rice is warm and the Nori is crispy. My favorite items were the toro hand roll, the albacore sushi and the Japanese yellowtail sushi. The price is also extremely reasonable, so you get plenty of high quality sushi for a good price. Because it’s a “no tipping establishment”, it ends up being surprisingly inexpensive
